unnormalised: Spice Wars Erupt in Local Kitchen!
normalised: Spice Wars Erupt in Local Kitchen!

unnormalised: A culinary clash of epic proportions unfolded yesterday in Mrs. Sharma's kitchen, all thanks to a misplaced decimal point! Sources say the gulab jamuns were meant to have 250 grams of sugar, but a mischievous ghost (or possibly her teenage son, Rohan) seems to have altered the measurement to 2.5 kg. The resulting dessert was so sweet, it allegedly caused Mr. Sharma's mustache to curl upwards permanently.
normalised: A culinary clash of epic proportions unfolded yesterday in Mrs. Sharma's kitchen, all thanks to a misplaced decimal point! Sources say the gulab jamuns were meant to have two hundred and fifty grams of sugar, but a mischievous ghost (or possibly her teenage son, Rohan) seems to have altered the measurement to two point five kilogram. The resulting dessert was so sweet, it allegedly caused Mr. Sharma's mustache to curl upwards permanently.

unnormalised: Eyewitness accounts confirm that the ensuing chai break required a whopping 5 liters of water to combat the sugar rush. The official explanation from Mrs. Sharma’s spokesperson (her pet parrot, Mithu) is that it was all a deliberate attempt to break a world record for "Sweetest Dessert Ever Made," although skeptics point to the recipe card with a crossed-out 'g' and a hastily scribbled 'kg.' Regardless, the incident has sparked a heated debate in the Sharma household over metric vs. imperial, with Rohan staunchly defending his conversion skills (or lack thereof). He claims he converted 250 grams to pounds, and forgot to convert it back to grams!
normalised: Eyewitness accounts confirm that the ensuing chai break required a whopping five liters of water to combat the sugar rush. The official explanation from Mrs. Sharma’s spokesperson (her pet parrot, Mithu) is that it was all a deliberate attempt to break a world record for "Sweetest Dessert Ever Made," although skeptics point to the recipe card with a crossed-out 'g' and a hastily scribbled 'kilogram.' Regardless, the incident has sparked a heated debate in the Sharma household over metric versus imperial, with Rohan staunchly defending his conversion skills (or lack thereof). He claims he converted two hundred and fifty grams to pounds, and forgot to convert it back to grams!

unnormalised: The sugar saga continues with experts being called in to assess the damage, currently estimated at approximately 3000 calories per serving. Early reports suggest a permanent ban on Rohan entering the kitchen unsupervised and a mandatory re-education program on the proper use of measuring spoons (especially the 1/2 tsp). The future of gulab jamuns in the Sharma household remains uncertain, but one thing is clear: cooking, like life, requires precise measurements, or you might just end up with a dessert that could power a small city.
normalised: The sugar saga continues with experts being called in to assess the damage, currently estimated at approximately three thousand calories per serving. Early reports suggest a permanent ban on Rohan entering the kitchen unsupervised and a mandatory re-education program on the proper use of measuring spoons (especially the half teaspoon). The future of gulab jamuns in the Sharma household remains uncertain, but one thing is clear: cooking, like life, requires precise measurements, or you might just end up with a dessert that could power a small city.
